concise_definition: n. 判断, 判决, 评价

definitions.explanation_en: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions, especially based on experience, knowledge, or wisdom.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指基于经验、知识或智慧做出深思熟虑的决定或得出合理结论的能力。
definitions.example_en: Her judgement in hiring employees has consistently improved the team's performance.
definitions.example_cn: 她在招聘员工方面的判断力一直显著提升了团队的表现。

definitions.explanation_en: An official decision or opinion issued by a court of law or a judge.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指法院或法官所作出的正式裁决或意见。
definitions.example_en: The judgement was delivered in court yesterday, finding the defendant guilty.
definitions.example_cn: 昨天法庭宣判，认定被告有罪。

definitions.explanation_en: An opinion or evaluation formed about someone or something, often after careful consideration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在仔细考虑后对某人或某事形成的评价或看法。
definitions.example_en: His judgement of the film was that it was overrated and lacked depth.
definitions.example_cn: 他对这部电影的评价是：被高估了，缺乏深度。

comparison.analysis: “Decision” (决定) 指在多个选项中选择一个具体行动方案，强调选择行为本身，通常更偏向于行动导向。而 “judgement” 更侧重于做出选择前的评估、权衡和判断过程，强调理性与洞察力。
“Opinion” (意见) 是主观的看法或信念，可能缺乏充分依据或深度思考。而 “judgement” 通常隐含了更严谨的分析、经验和理性判断，比 “opinion” 更具权威性和可信度。
“Verdict” (裁决) 是法律语境中陪审团或法官对案件事实问题的正式裁断，特指刑事案件或民事案件的最终结论。而 “judgement” 在法律中范围更广，可包括法律适用、量刑、解释条款等，是更全面的司法结论。
